name: One Person Company
shortDescription: One Person Company is a legal entity which has only one person as a member who will act in the capacity of a director as well as a shareholder.
description: One Person Company is a legal entity which has only one person as a member who will act in the capacity of a director as well as a shareholder. One Person Company has all the benefits of a Private Limited Company which means it has access to credit, bank loans, limited liability, legal protection for business, access to market etc. The sole member of the company can nominate a Nominee Director but he will have zero power until the death or incapacitation of the main Director.

benefits.heading: Benefits of incorporating a One Person Company

content.title: Minimal Compliance Requirement
content.description: All OPC businesses must maintain books of accounts, comply with statutory audit requirements and submit income tax returns and annual filings with the RoC. But there is no requirement to hold Board Meetings, Annual General or Extraordinary General Meetings.

content.title: Limited Liability
content.description: The shareholder liability is limited to his shareholding. This means any loss or debts in business will not impact, personal savings or wealth of the individual shareholder

content.title: Continuous Existence
content.description: An OPC company is a separate legal identity, so it continues to exist even if the main Director is no longer associated with the company. It would pass on to the nominee director and continue to exist until dissolved.

content.title: Improves Trust
content.description: As an OPC needs to have its books audited annually, it has greater credibility among vendors and lending institutions.

faqs.question: What is the difference between a One Person Company and Private Limited Company?
faqs.answer: One person company requires only one Director to incorporate the company while a Private Limited Company requires two Directors.

faqs.question: Can an NRI register a One Person Company?
faqs.answer: An OPC can only be registered by a citizen of India.

faqs.question: How much capital is required to start an OPC?
faqs.answer: There is no minimum paid-up capital required to start an OPC but It will need an authorized share capital of Rs. 1 lakh.

faqs.question: Should an OPC be renewed every year?
faqs.answer: No, an OPC does not require renewal every year. An OPC continues its existence until the main Director dissolves the company.
